41.heading: Anthems.
41.title: "Rabindranath Tagore : India's Gentle Torch-Bearer"
41.author: script, Kayanaksha Banerjee ; illustrations, Souren Roy ; cover, C
41.appears_in: M. Vitankar ; editor, Anant Pai. 31 p. in Amar Chitra Katha ; no. 548 (1977, 2005 printing).
notes: Summary from back cover: "He rejected formal education and yet began a world-famous university. His poems were mocked for the colloquial language but they were adopted as anthems by two countries. Bengali society despaired of him until he was awarded the coveted Nobel Prize for Literature and a knighthood! Rabindranath Tagore, whose multi-faceted life was as fascinating as it is inspiring, lives on in his books, his music and his thought-provoking, unconventional ideals."
Subtitle, series and summary from 2010 printing.

42.heading: Anthero.
42.title: "O Menino Guloso"
42.author: Gil
42.appears_in: p. 11 in O Tico-Tico : Jornal das Crianças, no. 3 (Oct. 25, 1905).
notes: Summary (by M. Harbeck): Educational picture story about young Anthero who is sent to the neighbor with a message but instead of delivering it greedily reaches for a bowl in the window. Slapped by his neighbor the bowl, full of honey, falls on him and as he runs home the neighbor sends her bees after him.
